title: Support projections for rest-data-panache
body:
### Description

Hello!

Reading the documentation here https://quarkus.io/guides/rest-data-panache there already appears to be a decent amount of customization, but I find myself in a situation where I think my needs exceeds the ability of rest-data to play nicely with my code.

If I have a class like `Person`:

```java
public class Person {
    String name;
    List<Friend> friends;
}
```

Assuming the `Friend` class is quite big and someone has a lot of friends, I would like to be able to specify an endpoint customization where, instead of the full person, I just get the name using a projection class while maintaining all the abilities of the rest-data resource like autogenerated paging, filtering, etc.

I've searched everywhere and the only way to do this currently (unless I'm missing something) is to either write a whole bunch of custom methods, or write my own rest endpoint just for this projection, but that would be pretty time consuming and bug prone.

### Implementation ideas

You already have the `@ProjectionFor` annotation. Maybe you could scan for it when generating the code, and make the rest endpoints using the class name. So if `Person` has `PersonProjection`, then the endpoints would be:

/root/person
/root/person-projection
